reviews.text: I visited Ealing Broadway train station on a rainy Tuesday afternoon. The platforms are huge with plenty of seating when waiting for your train. The Signage was good and the staff seem friendly and approachable. At the front of the station there is currently some building work going on, but there are signs to direct you to the entrance. My visit to Ealing Broadway Station was painless.

In one place there is a railway station, a coach station and subway stations. In addition, a huge number of stores and restaurants. Probably the most crowded place in London. I mean as stations go it’s fairly decent. It’s a good hub, as from Greenford you can basically get the tube to anywhere in London
Outdated station by about  20 years. I will edit my review when a lift is installed and awareness is shown to those who have mobility issues

Central and District lines run from here as do overground services to Paddington, out to Slough, Reading ect and to Heathrow Airport. Ealing Broadway station can get very busy. Access is from one end of the platforms which not only can result in crowds of people all but blocking a platform but also a semi chaotic experience just after the ticket barriers as people rush in different directions. For all that, this is a useful transit point with buses to many other destinations outside the station.

Big improvement with these new wider stairs which lead down to platform 2 and 3. Also it has new lighting, non-slip tiles and handrails on both sides and centre section. Big improvement over the old dated staircase.
